Class Switch

java.lang.Object
org.example.circuit_project.Components.Component
org.example.circuit_project.Components.Switch
public class Switch extends Component
Represents a switch component in a circuit that can toggle between open and closed states. When closed, it allows voltage to pass from input to output. When open, it blocks current.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class org.example.circuit_project.Components.Component

    Checks whether the switch is currently closed.

    Checks if the switch is actively conducting power.

    Resets the voltage of the switch and its ports to zero.

      Toggles the switch between open and closed states and updates its visual representation.

    • isClosed

      public boolean isClosed()
      Checks whether the switch is currently closed.
      Returns:
      true if the switch is closed; false if open

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the voltage of the switch and its ports to zero.
      Overrides:
      reset in class Component

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Disconnects the switch from all connected components and resets its state.

    • simulate

      public void simulate()

    • getPorts

      public List<Port> getPorts()
      Returns the list of ports associated with this switch (input and output).
      Specified by:
      getPorts in class Component
      Returns:
      a list containing the input and output ports

    • isPowered

      public boolean isPowered()
      Checks if the switch is actively conducting power.
      Specified by:
      isPowered in class Component
      Returns:
      true if closed and both input and output have voltage; otherwise false

    • propagatePower

      public void propagatePower(Set<Component> visited)
      Propagates power to connected components if the switch is closed and has voltage.
      Specified by:
      propagatePower in class Component
      Parameters:
      visited - the set of components already visited during propagation to prevent cycles
